pullRequest.body:
Introduce the notation `Mat[m,n][R]` for `Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R`.

[Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Why.20does.20.60Matrix.2Erow.60.20use.20.20.60Unit.60.20instead.20of.20.60Fin.201.60.3F/near/427949223)

---

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
An alternate choice would be
```lean
syntax term superscript(term) "ˣ" superscript(term) : term
macro_rules | `(term| $α $m:superscript ˣ $n:superscript) => `(Matrix (Fin $m) (Fin $n) $α)

#check ℝ¹ˣ²
```
Perhaps worth doing a poll on Zulip 

I tried to write a delaborator, but it doesn't work without #12193...
```lean
open Lean PrettyPrinter Delaborator SubExpr Qq in
@[delab app.Matrix]
def delabMatrix : Lean.PrettyPrinter.Delaborator.Delab := do
  let m ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 <| do
    let_expr Fin _ := ← getExpr | failure
    SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 delab
  let n ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 1 <| do
    let_expr Fin _ := ← getExpr | failure
    SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 delab
  let α ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 2 delab
  `(term| $α $m:superscriptˣ$n:superscript)
```

> An alternate choice would be
> 
> ```lean
> syntax term superscript(term) "ˣ" superscript(term) : term
> macro_rules | `(term| $α $m:superscript ˣ $n:superscript) => `(Matrix (Fin $m) (Fin $n) $α)
> 
> #check ℝ¹ˣ²
> ```

I did prefer your notation too, but I didn't get it working for `(n : Nat)`:
`#check ℝⁿˣⁿ`

I also tried `R^m×n` or `R^[m, n]` but there I ran into problems with parsing it as `HPow`.

Can do a poll nevertheless!

> Shouldn't the notation be `Mat[m, n][R]` rather than `Mat[m,n][R]` to avoid confusion with decimals?

Apparently the notation does not care about the whitespace regardless of how I define it. I did add the suggested space everywhere in mathlib, but `Mat[2,3][R]` still parses, correctly. (Maybe I'll add a test case to ensure this once the design questions are discussed)
I don't think it matters whether the spaceless notation parses but it matters that the spacefull notation is printed

Was this poll ever conducted? Let me label with `awaiting-zulip` for now, to reflect what seems to be the correct status.
(Also: if there is consensus, please fix the merge conflict. Thanks!)
The poll is [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Notation.20for.20Matrix.20.28Fin.20m.29.20.28Fin.20n.29.20R/near/433716941)

Ah this landed on the queue accidentally: I removed the `awaiting-review` label when that still existed. Now, without it, the PR should be a "draft".

I think the result of the poll was that people aren't keen on such notation.
Thanks for updating this status!
Shouldn't the notation be `Mat[m, n][R]` rather than `Mat[m,n][R]` to avoid confusion with decimals?
Shouldn't the notation be `Mat[m, n][R]` rather than `Mat[m,n][R]` to avoid confusion with decimals?

The main change.

All other changes are just to use the notation everywhere possible in mathilb.

pullRequest.title: feat(Data/Matrix/Basic): add notation for `m×n`-Matrices

nodes.body:
An alternate choice would be
```lean
syntax term superscript(term) "ˣ" superscript(term) : term
macro_rules | `(term| $α $m:superscript ˣ $n:superscript) => `(Matrix (Fin $m) (Fin $n) $α)

#check ℝ¹ˣ²
```
Perhaps worth doing a poll on Zulip 

I tried to write a delaborator, but it doesn't work without #12193...
```lean
open Lean PrettyPrinter Delaborator SubExpr Qq in
@[delab app.Matrix]
def delabMatrix : Lean.PrettyPrinter.Delaborator.Delab := do
  let m ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 <| do
    let_expr Fin _ := ← getExpr | failure
    SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 delab
  let n ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 1 <| do

    SubExpr.withNaryArg 0 delab
  let α ← SubExpr.withNaryArg 2 delab
  `(term| $α $m:superscriptˣ$n:superscript)
```
Shouldn't the notation be `Mat[m, n][R]` rather than `Mat[m,n][R]` to avoid confusion with decimals?

> An alternate choice would be
> 
> ```lean
> syntax term superscript(term) "ˣ" superscript(term) : term
> macro_rules | `(term| $α $m:superscript ˣ $n:superscript) => `(Matrix (Fin $m) (Fin $n) $α)
> 
> #check ℝ¹ˣ²
> ```

I did prefer your notation too, but I didn't get it working for `(n : Nat)`:
`#check ℝⁿˣⁿ`

I also tried `R^m×n` or `R^[m, n]` but there I ran into problems with parsing it as `HPow`.

Can do a poll nevertheless!

> Shouldn't the notation be `Mat[m, n][R]` rather than `Mat[m,n][R]` to avoid confusion with decimals?

Apparently the notation does not care about the whitespace regardless of how I define it. I did add the suggested space everywhere in mathlib, but `Mat[2,3][R]` still parses, correctly. (Maybe I'll add a test case to ensure this once the design questions are discussed)
I don't think it matters whether the spaceless notation parses but it matters that the spacefull notation is printed

Was this poll ever conducted? Let me label with `awaiting-zulip` for now, to reflect what seems to be the correct status.
(Also: if there is consensus, please fix the merge conflict. Thanks!)
The poll is [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Notation.20for.20Matrix.20.28Fin.20m.29.20.28Fin.20n.29.20R/near/433716941)

Ah this landed on the queue accidentally: I removed the `awaiting-review` label when that still existed. Now, without it, the PR should be a "draft".

I think the result of the poll was that people aren't keen on such notation.
Thanks for updating this status!
